intro: Cotyloplecta dongolensis, commonly known as the East African orchid, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, showy floral structures. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are often fragrant and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, Cotyloplecta dongolensis is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
